content: You are an expert translator proficient in Cantonese, English, and Mandarin. Your task is to translate a Cantonese word into its Mandarin counterpart by referencing its English definition.
<english>used with two noun phrases to indicate possession; denotes that the latter belongs to, or is a part of, the former; similar to English " 's "</english><cantonese>嘅</cantonese>
<english>loan shark; usurer; literally: big ear hole</english><cantonese>大耳窿</cantonese>
<english>to be or get stuck; to become lodged in</english><cantonese>𠽤/撠</cantonese>
